name: Action Surge
desc:
You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. After your Action, you can take one additional Action.

Once you use this Power, you must finish a Short Rest before you can use it again.

name: Improved Action Surge
desc:
You can push yourself beyond your normal limits repeatedly. After your Action, you can take one additional Action.

Once you use this Power a number of times equal to your Dexterity, you must finish a Short Rest before you can use it again.

name: Adrenaline Rush
desc: As a Bonus Action, you can move up to your Speed while an enemy can see or hear you. You can use this Power a number of times equal to your Strength, where you must finish a Long Rest before you can use it again. Whenever you use this trait, you gain Temporary Health equal to your Strength.

name: Agonizing Blast
desc: When you cast Eldritch Blast, add your Spellcasting Ability to the damage it deals on a hit.

name: Akimbo
desc: When wielding two Light Ranged Weapons and you make an Attack action with one, as a Bonus Action you can make an Attack with the other weapon. You do not add Accuracy to the damage roll of the second attack.

name: Ancestors of Stone
desc: As an Action you make your flesh turn as hard as stone. For 1 minute you Concentrate as if on a spell, and while concentrating you have resistance to non-magical physical damage and a +2 Bonus to Armour.

name: Aptitude
desc: The value of your Bonus is increased to +3. You can take this Power two more times, increasing your Bonus to +4 and then +5.

name: Arcane Aptitude
desc:
You have a natural grasp of arcane magic and with only a little preparation, can have ready a plethora of minor magics.

You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane Sphere spell list which you can switch for a different Arcane Sphere cantrip after a Long Rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

Additionally, you learn Arcane spells at twice the usual rate.

name: Arcane Recovery
desc:
You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a Short Rest, you can choose expended Mana Reserve to recover. The Reserve can have a combined value that is equal to your highest available Magnitude, to a maximum of 6.

For example, if you have Mana III, you can recover up to three points of Reserve, such as three Magnitude I Reserve, or one Magnitude II Reserve and one Magnitude I Reserve, or one Magnitude III Reserve.

name: Arcane Spellcasting
desc:
**Cantrips** - You know three cantrips of your choice from the Arcane Sphere.

**Spellbook** - You have a spellbook containing six 1st-Magnitude arcane spells of your choice. Your spellbook is the repository of the spells you know, except your Innate spells, which are fixed in your mind. You can add to your spellbook through two methods: spell invention or by copying spells you encounter in your adventures. Spell invention is a Downtime Activity, where you 'invent' a spell of your choice from the Arcane Sphere spell list.

**Transcription** - copying a spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the intricacies of the spell into a form your mind can replicate in magic. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds and/or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook. For each Magnitude of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

Any spell scrolls, spell books or willing teachers you encounter in your adventures can let you copy spells into your spellbook.

**Spell Invention** - enclosed in study, wizards perform experiments, decipher and combine criptic hints from fragmented scrolls and coax into existance entirely new spells. For each Magnitude of the Spell to be invented, the process takes 1 down time and 25gp. It can be any spell from the Arcane Sphere.

You can only invent and copy spells that you have the mana Magnitude for.

**Replacing the Book** - You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book-for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own studies and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell. If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many wizards keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

**The Book's Appearance** - Your spellbook is a unique compilation of spells, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

**Preparing and Casting Spells** - You use your Reserve of Mana to cast spells, gained through the Mana Power. In addition to any Innate spells you know, you prepare a list of arcane spells that are available for you to cast each day. To do so, choose a number of spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence + your Bonus. The spells must be of a Magnitude that you have the ability to Cast. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of arcane spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell Magnitude for each spell on your list.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your arcane spells, since you learn your spells through dedicated study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence when setting the saving throw DC for an arcane spell you Cast and when making an attack roll with one.

**Spell save DC** - 8 + your Bonus + your Intelligence

**Spell attack modifier** - your Bonus + your Intelligence

**Ritual Casting** - You can cast an arcane spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.

**Spellcasting Focus** - You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.

name: Arcane Ward
desc: You can amply and redirect threads of your defensive magic around yourself for greater protection. Whenever you cast an Abjuration spell of Magnitude I or higher, you can simultaneously create a magical ward on yourself or an ally within 30ft. The ward gives Temporary Health equal to your Bonus + your Intelligence.

name: Archery
desc: You gain a +2 additional Bonus to attack rolls you make with Crossbows, Bows and Slings.

name: Armour of Shadows
desc: You can cast Mage Armour on yourself at will, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components.

name: Artificer's Lore
desc: Whenever you make a History check related to magical, alchemical, or technological items, your proficiency Bonus is considered instead to be Expertise.

name: Aspect of the Moon
desc: You can no longer sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. You do not suffer Exhaustion for not sleeping. To gain the benefits of a Long Rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as divining the night sky or keeping watch.

name: Bardic Inspiration
desc:
You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use your Bonus Action to choose one character other than yourself within 60ft of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6.

Once within the next Short Rest, the character can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they make. The character can wait until after they roll the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the GM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A character can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.

You can use this Power a number of times equal to your Charisma. You regain any expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

name: Improved Bardic Inspiration
desc: You can use the Bardic Inspiration Power a number of times equal to your Charisma + your Bonus and the die increases from a d6 to a d10.

name: Beast Speech
desc: You can cast Speak with Animals at will, without spellcasting, or expending your Stipend / Mana.

name: Beguiling Influence
desc: You gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills. If you already had proficiency those skills, you gain Expertise instead.

name: Blessed
desc: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the divine sphere. Faith is your spellcasting ability for them.

name: Blessings of Knowledge
desc: In a moment of divine revelation, you learn two language Skills of your choice, also gaining Expertise with them. You also become Proficient and gain Expertise in your choice of two of the following skills: Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion. This is regardless of if you were Proficient with those skills or languages before.

name: Blind Fighting
desc: When in combat, you effectively have blindsight with a range of 10ft. Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're Blinded, in darkness, or otherwise have your senses obscured. Moreover, you can see an invisible character within that range, unless the character successfully Hides from you.

name: Bountiful Luck
desc:
Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions whenever you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it, you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor.

When an ally you can see within 30ft of you rolls a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your Bonus Action to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll, even if it is a 1.

When you use this Power, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn.

name: Cantrip Cornucopia
desc:
You learn another cantrip from your Patron's spell list, and one more cantrip of your choice from the list;

- Chill Touch
- Dancing Lights
- Eldritch Blast
- Gust
- Infestation
- Lightning Lure
- Magic Stone
- Mind Sliver
- Minor Illusion
- Prestidigitation
- Sapping Sting
- Shocking Grasp
- Thaumaturgy
- Vicious Mockery
- Word of Decay

name: Careful Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that forces other characters to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those characters from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve and choose a number of those characters up to your Spellcasting Stat. Chosen characters automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell.

name: Celestial Patron
desc:
**Healing Light** - you gain the ability to channel celestial energy to heal wounds. You have a pool of d6s equal to your Bonus + your Faith that you regain after a Long Rest. As a Bonus Action, you can spend these d6s to heal one character you can see within 60ft of you with a word of healing power whispered into your ear by your Patron. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Faith (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore an amount of Health equal to the total.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Faith. Faith for you is the following the orders, precepts and desires of your Patron. In addition, your maximum Faith is now 6, but your Faith can fall as low as -5 and is prone to fluctuating more rapidly than Divine Spellcasting spell casters (consult with your DM, but as a guide affect change at the end of each session).

**Spell List** - Divine Sphere

**Emblematic Spells** - In addition to the Divine Sphere spell list, you can choose from the following list.

| Magnitude | Spells |
| --- | --- |
| Cantrip | Eldritch Blast (but radiant damage), Blade Ward |
| I | Burning Hands, Faerie Fire (but white light), Sleep |
| II | Flame Blade, Fortune's Favour, See Invisibility |
| III | Call Lightning, Fear, Fly |
| IV | Charm Monster, Compulsion, Sickening Radiance (but harsh white light) |
| V | Contact Other Plane, Hold Monster, Wall of Light |
| VI | Globe of Invulnerability, Mass Suggestion, Tasha's Otherwordly Guise (Upper Planes only) |
| VII | Force Cage, Sequester |
| VIII | Antipathy/Sympathy, Power Word Stun |
| IX | Wish |

**Anathema** - Due to the limited nature of the Divine Sphere, the Celestial Patron finds none of its spells Anathema.

name: Close Quarters Shooter
desc: When making a ranged attack while you are within 5ft of a hostile character, you do not have Disadvantage on the attack roll. Your ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30ft of you. You have a +1 Bonus to attack rolls on ranged attacks.

name: Combat Expert
desc: You can Engage one more enemy at a time, up to the maximum number possible for your Size. You can take this power 4 more times, for a total of 5. The Dexterity prerequisite increases by 1 each time.

name: Combat Wild Shape
desc:
You gain the ability to use Wild Shape on your turn as a Bonus Action, rather than as an Action.

Additionally, while you are transformed by Wild Shape, you can use a Bonus Action to expend a Reserve of Mana to regain 1d8 Health per Magnitude of Mana expended. For example, if you expend a Reserve of Magnitude III, you regain 3d8 Health.

name: Cunning Action
desc: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take the Discern, Disarm, Dodge, or Parry actions as Bonus Actions instead.

name: Cursed
desc:
When you roll a 20 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you must reroll the die and use the new result, including if it is a 20.

Thankfully this misfortune has a habit of spreading, even to your enemies. Once per Long Rest you can turn one successful attack roll, skill check or saving throw of an enemy you can see into a failure.

name: Danger Sense
desc: You gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. You have Advantage on Reflex saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can't be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

name: Darkvision
desc: You can see in dim light within 60ft of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

name: Deepened Ki
desc: Increase the number of ki points you have access to by your Bonus. Your Ki save DC is also increased by your Bonus. If your Bonus is increased at some other point, remember to update the Ki gained from this Power. You can take this Power two more times for a total of 3 times, increasing your Ki and Ki Save DC by your Bonus each time.

name: Armour Expert
desc: While you are wearing armour, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armour. This does not include Shields or Helmets.

name: Determination
desc: When you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can do so with Advantage. Once you use this Power, you can't use it again until you finish a Short Rest.

name: Devil's Sight
desc: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, as if it were bright light to a distance of 120ft.

name: Disciple of Life
desc: Your healing spells are miraculously more effective. Whenever you use a spell of Magnitude 1 or higher to restore Health to a Character, the Character regains additional Health equal to 2 + the spell's Magnitude. You do not need to Channel Divinity to benefit from this Miracle.

name: Distant Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5ft or greater, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to double the range of the spell. When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to make the range of the spell 30ft.

name: Divine Domain
desc:
You immerse yourself in exemplifying the ways of your Faith, and your piety is rewarded with the following:

**Channel Divinity** - You gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel Miracles. You start with one Miracle of your choice (choose from Powers with the Miracle tag).

Some Miracles require you to 'Channel Divinity' as an Action or Bonus Action. You can Channel Divinity a number of times equal to your Faith, to a minimum of once. You must finish a Short Rest to regain your uses of Channel Divinity.

Some Miracles require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your Divine Spellcasting Save DC.

**Domain Spells** - Choose 2 Divine Sphere spells you have the Magnitude to cast that represent your faith, they are now Innate Spells for you and no longer count against your number of prepared spells.

When you take this Power again, you can choose an additional Miracle Power, and Domain Spells.

name: Divine Sense
desc:
The presence of strong evil registers on your senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an Action, you can open your awareness to detect such forces. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60ft of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type (celestial, fiend, or undead) of any being whose presence you sense. Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as if with the Hallow spell.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma. You regain all expended uses after a Long Rest.

name: Divine Smite
desc: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one Reserve of Mana to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for 1 Mana, plus 1d8 for each further point of Mana, to a maximum of 5d8. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an undead or a fiend, to a maximum of 6d8.

name: Divine Spellcasting
desc:
As a conduit for divine power, you can cast divine spells. You must have at least 0 Faith to learn and use this Power. If your Faith dips below 0, you no longer benefit from this Power or any that requires it until your Faith is restored.

**Cantrips** - You know three cantrips of your choice from the Divine Sphere spell list.

**Prepared Spells** - You prepare the list of Divine Sphere spells that are available for you to cast that day, choosing freely from the Divine Sphere spell list. When you do so, choose a number of spells equal to your Bonus + your Faith. The spells must be of a Magnitude for which you have Mana Reserve. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a Long Rest. Preparing a new list of Divine Sphere spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per Magnitude for each spell on your list.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Faith is your spellcasting ability for your spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Faith whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Faith when setting the saving throw DC for a Divine Sphere spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

**Spell Save DC** - 8 + your Bonus + your Faith

**Spell Attack Modifier** - your Bonus + your Faith

**Ritual Spellcasting** - You can cast a Divine Sphere spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

**Spellcasting Focus** - You can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

name: Draconic Affinity
desc:
When you cast a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your Draconic Ancestry, add your Spellcasting Ability to one damage roll of that spell. At the same time, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve, in addition to the Reserve spent on the spell, to gain Resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.

If your ancestry is one of the following, your damage type is:
- Brass - Fire
- Bronze - Lightning
- Copper - Acid
- Gold - Fire
- Silver - Cold

name: Draconic Bloodline
desc:
Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their descent back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might even have claimed a dragon parent. You gain the following benefits:

- You gain the Draconic Ancestry feature of the Dragonborn race, or a Dragonborn racial Power that you have the prerequisites for.
- As magic flows through your body, it causes physical traits of your dragon ancestors to emerge. Your Health increases by 2 and increases by 2 again whenever you gain Health from another Power.
- Parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. You have Natural Armour of 2.

name: Draconic Language
desc: You have an innate and full understanding of the language of Dragons. You are able to converse in Draconic, and as the language of creation, every utterence has greater weight, when you put your will behind it. Once per Short Rest, you can make a Charisma check with Advantage. When you do so, you speak Draconic, and yet any who hear you understand what it is you say.

name: Draconic Resistance
desc: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your ancestry.

name: Draconic Warding
desc: As an Action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. Until the start of the next Round, you become Immune to the damage type associated with your Draconic Ancestry. You can use this Power a number of times equal to your Fortitude per Long Rest.

name: Dragon Fear
desc: When angered, you radiate menace. Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can expend a use of your Draconic Ancestry's breath weapon to roar, forcing each character of your choice within 30ft of you to make a Willpower saving throw vs 8 + your Bonus + your Charisma. A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes Frightened for 1 minute. If the frightened target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Dragon Hide
desc:
You have scales and claws reminiscent of your draconic ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

- Your scales are hardened. You gain Natural Armour of 4.
- You can grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no Action. The claws are natural weapons. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength.

name: Dragon Wings
desc: You have draconic wings. With your wings, you have a flying speed of 20ft if you aren't wearing heavy armor and aren't exceeding your carrying capacity.

name: Drow High Magic
desc: You learn more of the magic typical of dark elves. You learn the Hunter's Mark spell and can cast once without expending Mana at Magnitude III. You also learn the Hold Person and Dispel Magic spells, each of which you can cast once without expending Mana at their lowest Magnitude. You regain the ability to cast these spells in this way when you finish a Long Rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

name: Drow Magic
desc: You learn the magic of the raiders of the dark places. You learn the Dancing Lights cantrip. You also learn the Faerie Fire and Darkness spells, each of which you can cast once without expending Mana. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a Long Rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

name: Druidic Apprentice
desc: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the nature sphere. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Verdance, as detailed in the [Verdance Table](/pedd/magic#verdance-table).

name: Duellist
desc: When wielding a one-handed melee weapon or a pistol, and no other weapons, you gain a +2 Bonus to damage rolls.

name: Dwarven Toughness
desc: Your Health maximum increases by 2, and it increases by 2 again for every Power that increases Health.

name: Eldritch Mind
desc: You have Advantage on Fortitude saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

name: Eldritch Sight
desc: You can cast Detect Magic at will, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components.

name: Eldritch Spear
desc: When you cast eldritch blast, its range is 300ft.

name: Elven Accuracy
desc: The accuracy of elves is legendary, especially that of elf archers and spellcasters. You have uncanny aim with attacks that rely on precision rather than brute force. Once per Short Rest, you have Advantage on a ranged weapon attack, or a ranged spell attack.

name: Empowered Spell
desc: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Spellcasting Stat. You must use the new rolls.

name: Everchanging Nature
desc: Your arcane nature grants you spell-like abilities as if you know the Prestidigitation cantrip. Additionally, after your 5th Power, you gain the ability to effectively cast the Absorb Elements spell at Magnitude II once with this Power and regain the ability to do so when you finish a Long Rest. After your 10th Power, you can effectively cast the Alter Self spell once with this Power and regain the ability to do so when you finish a Long Rest. Intelligence is your effective spellcasting ability for these Powers.

name: Expanded Repertoire
desc: Your Patronage spells increases to your Expertise + Spellcasting Ability (to a minimum of 2), and you may prepare your list of Patronage Innate Spells anew as if completing a Downtime Activity to do so.

name: Expert Skill
desc: You gain proficiency in one of Alchemy / Arcana / Disguise / Engineering / Investigation / Navigation / Strategy / Languages (one) / Medicine, in a Martial Skill of your choice, and in any one other Skill of your choice. Additionally, choose one Skill in which you have proficiency, now or before. You gain Expertise with that Skill.

name: Expertise
desc:
Choose two skills with which you are proficient. You now have Expertise in those skills (double your Bonus).

If you take this Power again, you choose two others of your proficienct Skills to gain Expertise in.

name: Extended Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

name: Extra Language
desc: You were raised in an environment that required you to become bilingual, and you've gained an aptitude for languages. You know one more Childhood Language, and you learn other languages at twice the usual rate.

name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
desc: You can read all writing and you are immune to Psychic damage from memetic hazards.

name: Favoured Enemy
desc:
You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy.

Choose a type of favoured enemy: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, demons, elementals, fell, fey, fiends, giants, jurors, lycanthropes, monstrosities, oozes, plants, sprites or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as favoured enemies. You gain the following benefits:

- You gain your Bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks against characters of the chosen type. Additionally, you have Advantage on Survival checks to track your favoured enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.
- When you gain this Power, your studies in the language of choice spoken by your favoured enemies (or reasonable alternative) comes to fruition and you become fluent in it. You gain proficiency in that language skill.

You can take this Power two more times, choosing two further enemy types and a language each time.

name: Fey Ancestry
desc: By ancient decree, your blood has been severed from the realm of dreams and cannot sleep. You have Advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

name: Fey Teleportation
desc: Drawing on your fey ancestry, you can momentarily stride through the Feywild to shorten your path from one place to another. You learn the Misty Step spell and can cast it once without expending Mana. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a Short Rest.

name: Field Alchemy
desc:
You are an expert at manipulating alchemy for use in combat and in the field.

**Formula Book** - An alchemist keeps meticulous formulas for every item they can create. You have a book of formulas. This formula book contains the formulas for two common 1st-level alchemical items of your choice. You can copy formula you find into your formula book, spending 50gp per level on the necessary experimentation and resources. If you take this power again, you invent 2 new formula of your choice, and add them directly to your book.

 **Field Alchemy** - You've learned how to quickly and reliably produce alchemical products even while out in the field. At the end of a Long Rest, you spend some time to create unstable alchemical items that can be used over the course of the day. You don't need to attempt a Crafting check to do this, you use an alchemist's toolkit, and you ignore both the number of days typically required to create the items and any alchemical raw materials requirements. Each item must be in your formula book, and have the consumable trait. These items remain potent for 24 hours or until your next Long Rest, whichever comes first, unless the item has an even shorter shelf life, in which case that is kept.

You can Craft a number of alchemical items whose level totals up to 4 + your Intelligence. If you take this Power again, add 4 to this value.

**Acid Vial** - In addition to your formulas, you can always prepare the alchemical item 'Acid Vial'. This tiny glass flask contains volatile chemicals that can be used offensively in a pinch. The glass vial, when thrown like a bomb, deals 1d6 acid damage and 1 Scatter acid damage to a target within 20ft, or 60ft at Disadvantage.

name: Fiendish Vigour
desc: You can cast False Life on yourself at will at Magnitude I, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components, as a 1 minute ritual involving blood letting, consumption of raw meat or other fiendish activity. You gain 10 Temporary Health, instead of 1d4 + 4.

name: Finder's High Magic
desc: You learn the Locate Animals or Plants and Locate Creature spells, each of which you can cast once without expending Mana at their lowest Magnitude. You regain the ability to cast these spells in this way when you finish a Long Rest. Perception is your Spellcasting Ability for these spells. Additionally, once per Long Rest you can divine a location as if you were casting the Scrying spell, see it for details.

name: Finder's Magic
desc: You learn the Hunter's Mark and Locate Object spells that you can cast without expending Mana. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell again until you finish a Long Rest. Perception is your Spellcasting Ability for these spells.

name: Fleet of Foot
desc: By foot, claw or wing, you're swifter than others. Increase your Speed by 5ft and your Travel Speed by 800 yards.

name: Force of Will
desc: The Magnitude of your Stipend increaes by 1 to a maximum of Magnitude V. All your Stiped spell casts must be at the maximum Magnitude

name: Foresighted Defence
desc: Your ability to read and predict your foes makes you harder to hit. When not wearing medium or heavy armour or using a shield, your Evasion is replaced by your Foresight (Perception + Intelligence) when calculating Defence.

name: Agile Defence
desc: Your ability to precisely and rapidly control the twists and bends your body makes, makes you harder to hit. When not wearing medium or heavy armour or using a shield, your Evasion is replaced by your Agility (Accuracy + Dexterity) when calculating Defence.

name: Gaze of Two Minds
desc: You can use your Action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of the next Round. As long as the character is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your Action on subsequent Rounds to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of the next Round. While perceiving through the other character's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that character, and you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

name: Grasp of Hadar
desc: Once per Round when you hit a character with your Eldritch Blast, you can move that character in a straight line 10ft in a direction of your choice.

name: Great Old One Patron
desc:
**Awakened Mind** - Your alien knowledge gives you the ability to touch the minds of other characters. You can telepathically speak to any character you can see within 30ft of you. You need to share a language with the character for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but you don't need to share a language to share emotions, impressions and simple concepts.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Intelligence. Additionally, your maximum Intelligence is now 6, and your Intelligence increases by 1 but your Charisma decreases by 1 (to a minimum of -3).

**Spell List** - Arcane Sphere

**Emblematic Spells** - In addition to the Arcane Sphere spell list, you can choose from the following list.

| Magnitude | Spells                                       |
| --------- | -------------------------------------------- |
| Cantrip   | Eldritch Blast, Vicious Mockery              |
| I         | Arms of Hadar, Dissonant Whispers            |
| II        | Enthrall, Immovable Object                   |
| III       | Conjure Barrage, Hunger of Hadar             |
| IV        | Compulsion, Gravity Sinkhole, Shadow of Moil |
| V         | Awaken, Destructive Wave                     |
| VI        | Gravity Fissure, Primordial Ward             |
| VII       | Tether Essence                               |
| VIII      | Dark Star, Reality Break                     |
| IX        | Ravenous Void                                |

**Anathema** - Spells from the Arcane Sphere unavailable to you.

| Magnitude | Spells                                     |
| --------- | ------------------------------------------ |
| Cantrip   |Friends                                    |
| I         | Cure Wounds, Protection from Good and Evil |
| II        | Aid, Lesser Restoration                    |
| III       | Catnap, Revivify                           |
| IV        | Fabricate, Summon Construct                |
| V         | Dawn, Greater Restoration                  |
| VI        | Sunbeam                                    |
| VII       | Sequester                                  |
| VIII      | Sunburst                                   |
| IX        | Wish                                       |

name: Great Weapon Fighting
desc: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

name: Greater Breath Weapon
desc:
You were born with a deeper connection to your draconic ancestry. Your Breath Weapon gains the following improvements:

- You do an additional 1d10 damage, if your Breath Weapon does damage
- The DC is calculated by 8 + your Fortitude + your Expertise
- The area, if a 5ft by 30ft line, is now a 5ft by 45ft line, or if a 15ft cone, is now a 20ft cone

name: Green Laird's Gift
desc: The Green Laird oversees a verdant realm of everlasting summer. Your soul is linked to their power. Whenever you regain Health from magic, you treat any dice rolled to determine the amount of Health you regain as having rolled their maximum value.

name: Grim Harvest
desc: You gain the ability to reap life energy from beasts, dragons, fell, fey, giants, lycanthropes, monstrosities, oozes, or plants you kill with your spells. Once per turn when you kill one or more of these characters with a spell of Magnitude I or higher, you regain Health equal to twice the spell's Magnitude, or three times its Magnitude if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy.

name: Grudge Bearer
desc:
You have a deep hatred for a particular kind of creature. Choose your foes, a type of creature to bear the burden of your wrath: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, demons, elementals, fell, fey, fiends, giants, lycanthropes, monstrosities, oozes, plants, sprites or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs). You gain the following benefits:

- During the first round of any combat against your chosen foes, your attack rolls against any of them have Advantage.
- When any of your chosen foes makes an opportunity attack against you, it makes the attack roll with Disadvantage.
- Whenever you make an Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion check to recall information about your chosen foes, you gain Proficiency in the roll if you don't already, Expertise if you are Proficient, or Advantage if you have Expertise.

name: Gruumsh's Fury
desc:
The fury of Gruumsh burns barely contained within you. You gain the following benefits:

- When you hit with an attack made with a melee weapon, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon's damage type.
- Immediately after you use your Racial Power taken with from your Red Rage heritage, you can make one weapon attack.

Once you use each of these abilities, you can't use it again until you finish a Short Rest.

name: Hale
desc: During a Short Rest you regain two times your Baseline Health during Recovery. You can take this power up to 3 times, where you regain three times, then four times your Baseline Health.

name: Hale Defence
desc: Your steadfast ability to take hits sees you through. When not wearing Armour, your Evasion is replaced by your Fortitude when calculating Defence. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

name: Hardy
desc: Increase your Health by your Fortitude + Willpower (to a minimum increase of 1) to your Health total. If you increase or decrease your Fortitude or Willpower at other times in the game, recalculate your Health Bonus from Hardy using the new values.

name: Heaven's Fall
desc: You can create a longbow using your Pact of the Blade Power. When you draw back its string and fire, it creates an arrow of white wood, which vanishes after 1 minute. You have Advantage on attack rolls against Aberrations, Demons, Fiends, Lycanthropes, Monstrosities, Sprites or Undead with the bow. When you hit a character with it, you can expend a Charge of your Stipend to deal an additional 2d8 radiant damage to the target per Magnitude.

name: Heightened Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that forces a character to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 3 Magnitude I Reserve to give one target of the spell Disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

name: Heritage of the Sea
desc: Adapted to life on the coasts and in the waters, you have a swimming speed of 30ft and can hold your breath for 1 hour.

name: Homing Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that requires you to make a spell attack roll or that forces a target to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to ignore the effects of half- and three-quarters cover against targets of the spell.

name: Hypnotic Gaze
desc:
Your soft words and enchanting gaze can magically enthrall another character. As an Action, choose one character that you can see within 5ft of you. If the target can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Willpower saving throw against your Spellcasting spell save DC or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn. The charmed character's speed drops to 0, and the character is Incapacitated and visibly dazed.

On subsequent Rounds, you can use your Action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of the Round. However, the effect ends if you move more than 5ft away from the character, if the character can neither see nor hear you, or if the character takes damage.

Once the effect ends, or if the character succeeds on its initial saving throw against this effect, you can't use this Power on that character again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Improved Minor Illusion
desc: When you cast Minor Illusion, you can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of the spell.

name: Improved Rage
desc:
While raging, when you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 Bonus to the damage roll, and your Rage doesn't end early unless you will it to with a Bonus Action.

Every time you take this power again, the bonus to damage, duration and strength prerequisite increase by 1.

name: Innate Spells
desc: Through intense study, practice and acumen, you learn two prepared spells from your available spell lists permanently as Innate Spells. You cannot learn spells of a Magnitude you do not have Mana for.

name: Inspiring Leader
desc: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly characters (which can include yourself) within 30ft of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each character can gain temporary hit points equal to your Bonus + your Charisma. A character cant gain temporary hit points from this Power again until it has finished a Short Rest.

name: Jack of All Trades
desc: You can add half your Bonus, rounded down, to any Checks you make that doesn't already include a Bonus.

name: Journeyman Mage
desc:
Choose a Sphere of Magic: Arcane, Divine, Occult or Primal. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that sphere's spell list.

In addition, choose one Magnitude I Spell to learn from that same spell list. Using this Power, you can cast the spell twice at Magnitude I, where you must then finish a Long Rest before you can cast it with this Power again.

Your spellcasting statistic for these spells depends on the class you chose: Intelligence for Arcane, Faith for Divine, Charisma for Occult or Verdance for Primal (see the [Verdance Table](/pedd/magic#verdance-table)).

Additionally, being a Journeyman Mage makes learning the corresponding Spellcasting Power and Mana Power much faster.

name: Keen Senses
desc: One of your senses is more accute than the average human's. Choose one of the senses (sight, hearing, touch, taste, smell or psychic). You add your Bonus to any Perception checks for this sense, when no Skill is in use. You can take this Power again for different senses.

name: Ki
desc:
Your inner training allows you to harness the mystical bodily energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points equal to your Willpower. You can spend these points to fuel various ki Powers. You start knowing four such Powers: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, Step of the Wind, and Swans Flight.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a Short Rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki Powers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. Your Ki save DC is 8 + your Bonus + your Willpower halved (rounded up).

- **Flurry of Blows** - Immediately after you take the Attack action, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a Bonus Action.
- **Patient Defense** - You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a Bonus Action.
- **Step of the Wind** - You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dash action as a bonus action without provoking Attacks of Opportunity, and your jump distance is doubled for the round.
-**Swans Flight** - You can spend 1 ki point to move along or up vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling when you take the Move Action. If you end your movement still on a vertical or liquid surface you must spend another Ki point to do Swans Flight in the next Round, or fall in the next Round instead.

name: Knowledge of the Ages
desc: You can Channel Divinity to tap into a divine well of knowledge, as an Action. You choose one Skill. For 10 minutes, you have Proficiency with the chosen Skill.

name: Lance of Lethargy
desc: Once per Round when you hit a character with your Eldritch Blast, you can reduce that character's speed by 10ft until the end of the next Round.

name: Lay on Hands
desc:
Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing energy that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total amount of Health equal to your Faith x 5.

As an Action, you can touch a character and draw energy from the pool to restore an amount of Health to that character, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

Alternatively, you can expend 5 Health from your pool of healing to cure the target of one Disease or remove the Poisoned condition from it. You can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple poisons with a single use of Lay on Hands, expending Health separately for each one.

This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

You cannot use this Power if your Faith falls below 1

name: Learned
desc: You gain Expertise in History, Arcana and Religion if you had Proficiency with each. As you gain Proficiency with each of these skills later, you also gain Expertise in them from Learned.

name: Lucky
desc: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

name: Mana
desc:
You're able to tap into a well of mystical energy within yourself known to practitioners as Mana. Your Mana comes in a Reserve, of which portions, or 'points', are at a certain Magnitude. Higher Magnitude Reserve can always be used at a lower Magnitude, though it still only counts as 1 point. Consult the table below by your rank in this Power to see what your Reserve is per Mag. (Magnitude). 

Your Reserve replenishes after a Long Rest.

Additionally, as you gain mana your natural aptitude for magic increases. You gain bonus Cantrips according to the Bonus Cantrips column, choosing them from the spell sphere lists you have access to. You may choose from; Druidcraft, Prestidigitation or Thaumaturgy, if for example don't have access to any spell spheres.
