name: Mana Manipulation
desc:
You can use your advanced control over magic to manipulate the levels of mana in your own body. By focusing your mind you can break down the bands of power within into discrete points of mana, that you can reassemble as you need.

- As a Bonus Action on your turn, you can expend 1 Reserve of mana of a given magnitude and gain a number of 'Mana Points' equal to the Magnitude's rank.
- You can transform Mana Points into one point of Reserve of a certain Magnitude as a Bonus Action during the Round. The Creating Reserve table below shows the conversion from Mana Points to Mana Reserve. You can create Reserve of no higher than Magnitude V. Any Reserve you create with this Power vanishes when you finish a Long Rest.

| Creating Reserve |                     |
| ---------------- | ------------------- |
| **Magnitude**    | **Mana Point Cost** |
| I                | 2                   |
| II               | 3                   |
| III              | 5                   |
| IV               | 6                   |
| V                | 7                   |

name: Mariner
desc:
As long as you are not wearing heavy armour or using a shield, you gain the following benefits:

- fighting in water does not confer Disadvantage to your attacks.
- your swim speed and climbing speed is doubled to a maximum of your Speed (by default your swim and climbing peeds are 1/4 of your Speed).
- you gain a +1 Bonus to your Evasion.

name: Marksman
desc: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with Firearms & Pistols without the Scatter property.

name: Martial Arts
desc:
Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and 'martial arts weapons': weapons which don't have the ranged, two-handed or heavy properties and with which you already have proficiency. You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only martial arts weapons and you aren't wearing armour or wielding a shield:

- You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and martial arts weapons.
- You can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage dice of your unarmed strike or martial arts weapon. The damage type is unchanged.
- When you use the Attack Action with an unarmed strike or a martial arts weapon, you can make one unarmed strike as a Bonus Action. For example, if you take the Attack Action and attack with a quarterstaff with which you are proficient, you can also make an unarmed strike as a Bonus Action, assuming you haven't already taken a Bonus Action this round.

name: Mask of Many Faces
desc: You can cast Disguise Self at will, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components.

name: Menacing
desc: Your visage is naturally intimidating. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

name: Meta Magic
desc: You've learned to invest more power into spells to manipulate them on the fly. You gain two 'Meta-magic' Powers of your choice, if you meet the prerequisites, and you can choose two new meta-magic options when take this Power again. Unless otherwise stated, a spell can have any number of different meta-magic effects applied to it at a time, but each effect can only be applied once.

name: Minor Alchemy
desc: When you studied transmutation, you learned to temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone (but not a gemstone), lead, iron or other common metals, or silver, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each 10 minutes you spend performing the procedure, you can transform up to 1 cubic foot of material. After 1 hour, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), the material reverts to its original substance.

name: Minor Conjuration
desc:
You can use your Action to conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10ft of you. This object can be no larger than 3ft on a side and weigh no more than 10lbs, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5ft.

The object disappears after 1 hour, when you use this Power again, or if it takes or deals any damage, after that damage has been taken / dealt.

name: Mist Mad
desc:
Many Gnomes are cautioned to avoid the Mists at all costs, and many heed those wise words. Those that don't are often doomed to be hypnotized by the Mist's maddening swirls, and be drawn deep within. Those that survive are inevitably deeply changed, and far from home. You have several major mutations warping and twisting your body in many locations, which have a collective effect. The effect of these mutations is not only to make you look like the horror that peasants tell tales of to frighten their children, enough to even make Mistdivers flinch at your visage, but one of the following;
- **Bulging Skin-Bursting Muscles** - you ignore the heavy property of weapons, you gain proficiency in Athletics, and your Strength is increased by 1
- **Pawed digitigrade Hooves and Tail** - your movement speed is now 35ft, you gain proficiency in Acrobatics, and your Dexterity is increased by 1
- **Armoured Shell and Scales** - you gain Natural Armour of 5. You are resistant to Slashing damage, and your Fortitude is increased by 1.
- **Headful of Mismatched Eyes** - your passive perception is increased by 5, you gain proficiency in Observation, and your Perception score is increased by 1.
- **Hypnotic Bioluminescence** - you know the Friends cantrip, using your Charisma to cast the spell, you gain proficiency in Persuasion, and your Charisma score is increased by 1.

name: Misty Visions
desc: You can cast Silent Image at will, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components.

name: Natural Aptitude
desc:
This race has a natural aptitude for picking up abilities quickly, weilding them as well as other Races are born to their own natural abilities. Choose any non-racial Power where the Statistic Prerequisites do not total above 1 and you qualify for that Power, and take that Power as your Natural Aptitude.

This Power can be taken twice, choosing a different non-racial Power each time.

name: Natural Artifice
desc: You gain the benefits of the Artificer's Lore Power, only for you such knowledge is instinctual rather than learned.

name: Natural Camouflage
desc: You can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface as an Action, such as a tree or wall, that is at least as tall and wide as you are, or against the ground by going Prone. You gain a +10 bonus to Stealth checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking Actions. Once you move or take an action or bonus action, you must camouflage yourself again to gain this benefit.

name: Natural Explorer
desc:
You are a master of navigating two types of natural environment, and you react with swift and decisive action when attacked in such regions. Choose two types of favoured terrain: boreal, aquatic, deserts, woods, jungles, plains, mountains, swamps, or underground. When in such terrain you have the following benefits:

- You ignore difficult natural terrain of that environment.
- You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.
- Your first Attack in a combat has Advantage.
- Verdance is one higher for you in your terrain, if you have Primal Spellcasting (up to a maximum of 6).

While travelling in your favoured terrain, you gain the following benefits:

- Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel, and your group can move stealthily at a normal pace.
- Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
- Even when you are engaged in another activity while travelling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
- When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
- While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

When you retake this Power, choose two new favoured terrain types.

name: Natural Illusionist
desc:
You know the Minor Illusion cantrip and the Silent Image spell, which you can cast once without expending Mana. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a Short Rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting attack modifier for it.

Additionally, you learn illusion school spells at twice the usual rate.

name: Naturally Stealthy
desc: You gain profiency in Stealth, and you can attempt to hide even when you are only obscured by an object or character that is the same size as you.

name: Occult Spellcasting
desc:
An event in your past, or in the life of a parent or ancestor, left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with occultish magic. This font of magic, whatever its origin, fuels your spells.

**Cantrips** - You know four cantrips of your choice from the Occult Sphere spell list.

**Spells Known** - You know two Magnitude I spells of your choice from the Occult Sphere spell list as Innate Spells. When you gain a rank in the Mana Power, you learn one more Occult Sphere spell of a Magnitude which you have Reserve for, also as an Innate Spell.

Additionally, when you gain a rank in Mana, you can choose one of the Innate Occult Sphere Spells you know and replace it with another from the Occult Sphere spell list, which also must be of a Magnitude for which you have Reserve.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Your spellcasting ability for Occult Spellcasting depends on the school of the spell that you cast, since the power of your magic relies on your body's ability to conjure, fuel and guide the magic, rather than any specific learning.
- For Abjuration, Conjuration and Enchantment spells you use your Fortitude.
- For Illusion and Transmutation spells you use your Reflexes.
- For Divination, Evocation and Necromancy spells you use your Willpower.

In addition, you use this Stat when setting the saving throw DC for an Occult spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

**Spell Save DC** = 8 + your Bonus + your Spellcasting Ability (halved, rounded up)

**Spell Attack Modifier** = your Bonus + your Spellcasting Ability (halved, rounded up)

For example, if you're casting Fire Bolt, an Evocation spell, your Ranged Spell Attack is made with your Willpower, and if your Willpower is +3 and your Bonus is +2, your Spell Attack Modifier would be +4 (+2 Bonus, 3 / 2 is 1.5, rounded up to 2. 2 + 2 is 4)

**Spellcasting Focus** - You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your sorcerer spells.

name: Otherworldly Patron
desc: You have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice. When you take this Power, choose one Patron Power, your Patron. You may not strike more than one bargain.

name: Overcharge
desc: Your Stipend Charges increase by one. You can take this Power a maximum of 3 times, for a maximum of 5 Charges.

name: Pact Magic
desc:
Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells.

**Cantrips** - You know two cantrips of your choice from the Spell List of your Patron. Through the Cantrip Cornucopia Invocation, you can gain more cantrips.

**Stipend** - Your Patron bestows upon you a stipend of magical power, that you must expend as Mana Reserve at Magnitude I. You regain all your Stipend when you finish a Short Rest. You have 2 Charges of your Stipend, and can increase the number of Charges of it through the Overcharge Invocation, and the Magnitude through the Force of Will Invocation. All Pact Magic spells are cast at the maximum Magnitude available to you. Stipend is not Mana, and cannot be used in Mana-requiring Powers. However you may cast spells from your Patronage with your own Mana Reserve, if you have any.

**Patronage** - Choose a number of spells from the Spell List of your Patron equal to your Bonus + your Patron's Spellcasting Ability (to a minimum of 1). These are Innate Spells for you. If these Stats increase, you may choose more spells. As a Downtime Activity, you can commune with your Patron and they may choose to allow you to change one, some or all of your Innate Spells up to the Magnitude you have the Stipend to cast (Downtime Activities are 2 days or more of non-adventuring, consult with your DM).

**Spellcasting Ability** - your Spellcasting Ability is determined by your Patron.

**Spell Save DC** = 8 + your Bonus + your Spellcasting Ability

**Spell Attack Modifier** = your Bonus + your Spellcasting Ability

**Spellcasting Focus** - You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your Occult Sphere spells.

name: Portent
desc:
Your mind has been opened to the fabric of fate: glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness. When you finish a Long Rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or stat check made by you or a character that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per Round.

Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a Long Rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

name: Primal Spellcasting
desc:
**Cantrips** - You know two cantrips of your choice from the Primal Sphere.

**Preparing and Casting Spells** - You use your Reserve of Mana to cast spells. In addition to any Innate spells you know, you prepare a list of primal spells that are available for you to cast each day. To do so, choose a number of spells from the Primal Sphere spell list. The spells must be of a Magnitude that you have the Reserve for. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a Long Rest. Preparing a new list of primal spells requires time spent communing with nature and absorbing the instincts and hidden wisdom needed to cast the spells: at least 1 minute per spell Magnitude for each spell.

**Spellcasting Ability** - Your spellcasting ability is determined by the current Verdance of nature where you are, as detailed in the Verdance table below. You use Verdance whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use Verdance when setting the saving throw DC for a primal spell you Cast and when making an attack roll with one.

**Spell save DC** - 8 + your Bonus + Verdance

**Spell attack modifier** - your Bonus + Verdance

**Ritual Casting** - You can cast a primal spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

**Spellcasting Focus** - You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your Primal spells.

| Verdance | Barren | Poor | Middling | Rich | Abundant|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|Boreal|-1|0|1|2|4|
|Deeps|-1|0|1|2|4|
|Deserts|-1|0|1|2|4|
|Jungles|1|2|3|4|5|
|Plains|0|1|2|3|4|
|Mountains|-1|0|1|2|4|
|Shallows|1|2|3|4|5|
|Swamps|0|1|2|3|4|
|Underground|-1|0|1|2|4|
|Woods|0|1|2|3|4|

name: Prodigy
desc:
You have a knack for learning new things. You gain the following benefits:

- You gain proficiency in a Basic Skill, Knowledge Skill and one language of your choice.
- Choose one Skill in which you have proficiency, now or before. You gain Expertise with that Skill.
- You learn skills at quicker than the usual rate.

name: Professional Artisan
desc: When not at Disadvantage, you can choose to spend at least 1 minute and not roll when making any Tool Set or Crafting check with which you are proficient and instead assume you rolled a 10, adding a Stat and any Bonus to that as normal. Any check that would normally take longer than 1 minute still does so.

name: Protective Fighter
desc: When a character you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5ft of you, you can use your Bonus Action to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a Shield or a weapon with the Block property.

name: Psychic Sense
desc: You gain the Psychic sense, and you can speak in a language of your choice telepathically to any character within 30ft of you, and if you maintain the connection they may speak back. You can speak telepathically in this way to one character at a time.

name: Quickened Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 Action, you can spend 2 Magnitude I Reserve to change the casting time to 1 Bonus Action for this casting.

name: Rage
desc:
In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. You can enter a rage as a Bonus Action.

While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armor:

- You have advantage on Strength checks and Fortitude saving throws.
- When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +1 Bonus to the damage roll.
- You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
- If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while raging.
- Your Rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a Bonus Action.

Once you have raged a number of teams equal to your Willpower, you must finish a Long Rest before you can Rage again.

name: Reckless Attack
desc: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. If you decide to attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage until the next turn.

name: Relentless Endurance
desc: When you are reduced to 0 Health but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Health instead. You can't use this Power again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Resistance Increase
desc: Increase one Resistance by +2, to a maximum of +10.

name: Savage Attacks
desc: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

name: Savage Magic
desc: When you score a critical hit with a spell attack, you can roll one of the spell's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

name: Savant
desc:
Choose a spell school (Abjuration, Conjuration, Divination, Enchantment, Evocation, Illusion, Necromancy or Transmuation). The gold and time you must spend to copy a spell of that school into your spellbook is halved. In addition, when you make skill checks to do with this branch of magic, you do so as if you had Proficiency. If you would have Proficiency anyway, you do so with Expertise.

You can take this Power again, but you must choose a different spell school each time.

name: Scrivener's Magic
desc: You learn the magic of the learned scribe. You learn the Message cantrip. You also learn the Comprehend Languages and Illusory Script spells, each of which you can cast once without expending Mana or requiring components. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a Long Rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Sculpt Spells
desc: You can try to create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your Evocation spells. When you cast an Evocation spell that affects other characters that you can see, you can choose to make an Arcana Skill check against a DC of 15 to spare a number of equal to your Intelligence. If you succeed, the chosen characters automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

name: Second Chance
desc: When a character you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can force that character to reroll. They must use the second result, even if it is better. Once you use this Power, you can't use it again until a new combat begins or you finish a Short Rest.

name: Second Wind
desc:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain Health equal to 1d10 + your Bonus.

Once you use this Power, you must finish a Short Rest before you can use it again.

name: Refocus
desc:
You have the capability to calm yourself and recentre even during the whirlwind of combat. On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain Focus equal to your Willpower.

Once you use this Power, you must finish a Short Rest before you can use it again.

name: Secret Language
desc: You know the secret language of a cloistered society, gang, network or other such group. You can speak the language and use it to leave coded messages, the medium varying significantly between secret languages. You and others who know this language automatically spot and decipher such a message. Others who listen to or encounter encoded messages can't decipher the language without magic.

name: Secrets of the Land
desc:
Your magic is influenced by the druidic practicies, mysterious rites and primal secrets of a land that you bind yourself to, even as you carry its power wherever you go.

**Land Spells** - Choose 2 Primal sphere spells you can cast that represent the land that you bound yourself to, they are now Innate Spells for you.

**Natural Recovery** - You can regain some of your magical energy by sitting in meditation and communing with nature. During a Short Rest, you choose expended Mana to recover up to a third of your rank in the Mana Power, rounded up. If you're Rank 3 in Mana, you recover Rank 1 Mana, that is to say 2 Magnitude I points. If you're Rank 7 in Mana, you recover Rank 2 Mana: 4 Magnitude I points and 2 Magnitude II points. You can't use this Power again until you finish a Long Rest.

When you take this Power again, you gain the benefit of Land Spells. You can take this Power 2 more times, up to 3 times.

name: Seeking Spell
desc: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 Magnitude I Reserve to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll.

name: Skulker
desc:
You are an expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:

- You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the character from which you are hiding.
- When you are hidden from a character and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.
- Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on your Perception checks relying on sight.

name: Sneak Attack
desc:
You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per Round, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage of your weapon's damage type to one Character you hit with an attack if you have Advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use your Dexterity or Accuracy.

You don't need Advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5ft of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

When you take this Power again, increase the damage bonus by 1d6. You can take this Power 4 more times, for a total of 5 times.

name: Sniper
desc: When you hit with a Ranged Weapon Attack against a Character 60ft away or further, you gain your Bonus to the damage roll.

name: Song of Rest
desc: You can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a Short Rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain Health at the end of the Short Rest, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 Health.

name: Sorcerous Origin
desc:
One of the rare lucky, or cursed, few: you have been graced with an inherent source of magical power. You may have been born with it, or had it thrust upon you. Nevertheless from it comes your ability to cast Occult Magic. Choose one Sorcerous Origin Power you have the prerequisites for. You cannot take this Power more than once or benefit from more than one Sorcerous Origin.

*You may take this Power as a Racial Power no matter your Race, or as your Background Power. If you do you must, as one of your first 3 Powers, take the Occult Spellcasting Power, which means you must also take Mana as one of your first 3 Powers.

name: Speak with Small Beasts
desc: You learn the secret language of Sylvan, the skill Language (Sylvan), and through this language, sounds and gestures, you may communicate simple ideas to Small or smaller beasts and receive simple information from them as appropriate to the beast in question, although they cannot speak back.

name: Squat and Nimble
desc: You can move through the space of any character that is of a size larger than yours, and you gain proficiency in Acrobatics or Athletics (your choice). You have Advantage on Athletics or Acrobatics (depending on which you chose) checks to escape being Grappled.

name: Statistic Increase
desc: Increase one Statistic by +1, to a maximum of +5.

name: Stonecunning
desc: Whenever you make an History check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered Proficient in the History skill if you are not, or to have Expertise if you're Proficient. If you have Expertise in History, you make History checks related to the origin of stonework with Advantage.

name: Stout Resiliance
desc: You have Advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have Resistance to poison damage.

name: Subtle Spell
desc: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

name: Svirfneblin Magic
desc:
You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors.

You learn to cast each of the following spells once without expending Mana with this Power: Blindness/Deafness, Blur, Disguise Self, and Nondetection (targetting only yourself but without needing the 25gp material component). You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a Long Rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

name: Swift
desc: You're faster on your feet, or however else it is you locomote, than others. Increase your Speed by 10ft and your travel speed by 1 mile. When you take this Power again, increase the Dexterity prerequise by 1 for each Rank you have in this Power. You can take this Power 2 more times, up to 3 times, though each time you take this Power the Dexterity prerequisite increases by one.

name: Tactical Wit
desc: Your keen ability to assess tactical situations allows you to act quickly in battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence.

name: Thief of Five Fates
desc: You can cast Bane once per Long Rest, without spellcasting, expending your Stipend / Mana, or needing material components.

name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
desc: You can draw a weapon that has the Thrown property as part of the Attack Action you make with the weapon. In addition, if you hit, you gain a +2 Bonus to the damage roll.

name: Tinkerer
desc:
You gain proficiency with in the Engineering Skill. Using Tinkerer's tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (1 Health, 5 Defence). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your Action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

- **Clockwork Toy**. This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
- **Fire Starter**. The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
- **Music Box**. When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.
- At your DM's discretion, you may make other objects with effects similar in power to these. The Prestidigitation cantrip is a good baseline for such effects.

name: Transmuted Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that deals a type of organic or energy damage (see the following list), you can spend 1 Magnitude I Reserve to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, psychic.

name: Troglobite
desc:
You have Superior Darkvision:
- You gain the Power Darkvision but to a range of 120ft, instead of 60ft. 

However, you have Sunlight Sensitivity:
- You have Disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

name: Turn Undead
desc:
As an Action, you Channel Divinity and present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30ft of you must make a Willpower saving throw. If the undead fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned undead must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30ft of you. For its Action, it can only Move or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from Moving. If there's nowhere to move, the undead can use the Dodge action.

name: Twinned Spell
desc: When you cast a spell that targets only one character and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend another Reserve of Mana of the spell's Magnitude to target a second character in range with the same spell (or 1 Reserve of Magnitude I if the spell is a cantrip). To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one character at the spell's current Magnitude. For example, magic missile and scorching ray aren't eligible, but ray of frost and chromatic orb are.

name: Two Weapon Fighting
desc: You can make an Off-Hand Strike even if neither weapon has the Light property, although neither weapon may have the Heavy Property, and you can add your attack Statistic to the damage roll of the Off-Hand Strike.

name: Unarmed Fighting
desc:
You've trained extensively in unarmed combat, gaining the following benefits:

- You gain Proficiency in Body and Improvised Weapons if you were not already.
- Your Unarmed Attacks can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, the d4 becomes a d6.
- Your Unarmed and Improvised Attacks contain the Block I, Finesse and Parry (Bludgeoning) properties.

name: Grappler
desc:
You've developed the skills necessary to excel in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

- When you hit a character with an Unarmed or Improvised Strike, you can use a Bonus Action to attempt to Grapple the target.
- You can use any non-Heavy weapon to attack the Character you are grappling
- You have Advantage on attack rolls against a character you are grappling.
- You can use your Action to try to Stun the character grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, they are Stunned for the rest of the Round.

name: Unleashed Wild Shape
desc:
You dive more deeply into the power of the animal wild, and you gain the following benefits:

- Increase Challenge Rating limit of your Wild Shape by 1/2, to a maximum of 3
- Increase the number of hours you can stay in Wild Shape by 1, to a maximum of 6
- Choose one category: flying speed, burrowing speed, swimming speed, dragon, elemental, fell, fey, giant, lycanthrope, monstrosity, ooze, plant. You can now Wild Shape into a creature that has this kind of movement that belongs to a category you can Wild Shape into, or belongs to the new category, that you have studied, as with normal Wild Shape.

name: Warding Flare
desc:
You gain the Light cantrip. If you already know this cantrip, you learn a different Divine Sphere cantrip of your choice.

You can Channel Divinity and interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a character within 30ft of you that you can see, you can use your Bonus Action and impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses. An attacker that can't be blinded is immune to this Miracle.

You can use this Miracle a number of times equal to your Faith (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a Rest.

name: Martial Master
desc: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, armour and shields. You can swap between two weapons/shields once per Round without needing an action and you gain Proficiency in four Martial Skills of your choice. If you take this Power again, you gain a further four Martial Skill proficiencies each time.

name: Resilient
desc: You gain your Bonus on saving throws with your choice of Fortitude, Reflexes or Willpower. You can take this Power again, chosing a different Resistance each time.

name: Wild Magic
desc:
Your innate magic comes from the wild forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation. You might have endured exposure to some form of raw magic, perhaps through a planar portal leading to Limbo, the Elemental Planes, or the mysterious Far Realm. Perhaps you were blessed by a powerful fey creature or marked by a demon. Or your magic could be a fluke of your birth, with no apparent cause or reason. However it came to be, this chaotic magic churns within you, waiting for any outlet.

**Wild Magic Surge** - Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. You roll a d20 immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of Magnitude I or higher for the first time in a Round. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect. If that effect is a spell, it is too wild to be affected Meta Magic, if you're able, and if it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

**Tides of Chaos** - You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain Advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a Long Rest before using Tides of Chaos again. If you have a Wild Magic Surge, you regain the use of Tides of Chaos.

name: Wild Shape
desc:
You can use your Action to magically assume the shape of a Beast that you have learned before (what constitutes 'learning a creature' depends on the creature and the circumstances, typically an hour of unobtrusive observation).

- You can use this Power a number of times equal to your Willpower. You regain expended uses when you finish a Short Rest.
- You can transform into any beast that has a Challenge Rating of 1/2 or lower that doesn't have a flying, burrowing or swimming speed.
- You can stay in a wild shape for 1 hour. You then revert to your normal form unless you expend another use of this Power. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a Bonus Action. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 Health, or die.

While you are transformed, the following rules apply:

- Your Strength, Dexterity, Accuracy and Perception statistics are replaced by those of the Creature. You retain your Intelligence and Charisma statistics, and also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the Creature. If the Creature has the same Proficiency Bonus as you, but the Bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the Creature's Bonus instead of yours. If the Creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.
- When you transform, you assume the beast's full Health. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the Health value you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 Health, any excess damage carries over to your normal form, For example, if you take 10 damage in a form that has only 1 Health left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 Health, you aren't knocked unconscious.
- You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands or humanoid mouth is limited to the capabilities of your form. Transforming doesn't break your Concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as Call Lightning, that you've already cast.
- You retain the benefit of any Powers and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, as your senses are replaced, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has them.
- You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the GM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

name: Wonder Maker
desc:
You master the techniques of tinkering. You gain Expertise with Tinker's Tools.

When you make a device with your Tinker Power, you have the following additional options for what you make:
- **Alarm**: This device senses when a charater moves to within 15ft of it without speaking aloud a password chosen when you create it. One round after a character moves into range, the alarm makes a shrill ringing that lasts for 1 minute and can be heard from up to 300ft away.
- **Mechanical Calculator**: This device makes doing sums trivial.
- **Lifter**: This device can be used as a block and tackle, allowing its user to hoist five times the weight the user can normally lift.
 - **Timekeeper**: This pocket watch keeps accurate time.
 - **Weather Sensor**: When used as an action, this device predicts weather conditions in a 1-mile radius over the next 4 hours, showing one symbol (clouds, sun/moon, rain, or snow) for each hour

name: Wood Elf Magic
desc: You learn the magic of the primeval woods, which are revered and protected by your people. You learn one Primal Sphere cantrip of your choice. You also learn the Longstrider and Pass Without Trace spells, each of which you can cast once without expending Mana. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a Long Rest. The Verdance of your locale is your spellcasting ability for all three spells. See the [Verdance Table](/pedd/magic#verdance-table).

name: Discovery
desc: From the quiet seclusion of extended hermitage, the sudden revelation of a cosmic insight, the convalescence of years of studies or other such momentous personal event, you gain access to a unique and powerful discovery. The exact nature of this revelation depends on the nature of your seclusion. It might be a great truth about the cosmos, God, the ethereal beings of the psychic realm, or the forces of nature. It could be a site that no one else has ever seen. You might have uncovered a fact that has long been forgotten, or unearthed some relic of the past that could rewrite history. Work with your GM to determine the details of your discovery and its impact on the campaign.

name: Observant
desc:
Quick to notice details of your environment, you gain the following benefits:

- If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips.
- Your passive Perception is increased by your Bonus.
-You gain proficiency in one of your choice of: Insight, Investigation, Observe

name: Healer
desc:
You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

- When you use a healer's kit to stabilize a dying character, that character also regains 1 health.
- As an action. you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a character and restore 1d6 + 4 health to it. The character can't regain health from this Power again until it finishes a long rest.

name: Escape Artist
desc: You can take the Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

name: Reversal of Mania
desc: Your days of being subject to your own urges are gone, and you have achieved a discipline of mind that most creatures of the material world find astounding, especially in contrast to normal Goblins. You have advantage on any saving throw caused by a spell from the enchantment school of magic. You also have advantage on any further saving throws made to end an ongoing enchantment spell's effect.

name: Sneaky
desc: You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill. If you were already, or later gain proficiency, you instead gain Expertise in the Stealth skill.

name: Long-limbed
desc: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

name: Powerful Build
desc: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You gain the Athletics skill, or if you had it already you gain Expertise.

name: Hooked Claws
desc: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make attacks with proficiency even if you lack Body proficiency. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength. In addition, if the character was surprised by the Hooked Claws strike (due to a surprise round, being hidden, etc), you can make a free grapple check against the character.

name: Martial Heritage
desc: After undergoing your transformations and at last being admitted into a holdfast (or from some other tutor or training), you have been trained and readied for war. You are proficient in the next tier of armour skill (Light Armour if you weren't proficient in any, Medium Armour if you were proficient in light, Heavy Armour if you were proficient in medium), and you are proficient in using Knives and Clubs & Axes. In addition, you are proficient in two martial skills of your choice.

name: Magical Tinkering
desc:
You've learned how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects. To use this ability, you must have thieves' tools or artisan's tools in hand. You then touch a Tiny nonmagical object as an Action and give it one of the following magical properties of your choice:

 - The object sheds bright light in a 5ft radius and dim light for an additional 5ft.
 - Whenever tapped by a character, the object emits a recorded message that can be heard up to 10ft away. You utter the message when you bestow this property on the object, and the recording can be no more than 6 seconds long.
 - The object continuously emits your choice of an odor or a nonverbal sound (wind, waves, chirping, or the like). The chosen phenomenon is perceivable up to 10ft away.
 - A static visual effect appears on one of the object's surfaces. This effect can be a picture, up to 25 words of text, lines and shapes, or a mixture of these elements, as you like.

The chosen property lasts indefinitely. As an action, you can touch the object and end the property early. You can bestow magic on multiple objects, touching one object each time you use this Power, though a single object can only bear one property at a time. The maximum number of objects you can affect with this Power at one time is equal to your Intelligence. If you try to exceed your maximum, the oldest property immediately ends, and then the new property applies.

Additionally, if you have the Arcane Spellcasting Power, you may use your thieves' or artisan's tools as a spellcasting focus.

name: Heavy Attack
desc: Whenever you take the Attack Action on your turn to make a weapon attack that uses Strength, you double the damage dice of the weapon.

name: Extra Attack
desc: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack Action on your turn to make a weapon attack that uses Accuracy (if you have +3 in Accuracy or more), or Dexterity (if you have +3 in Dexterity or more).

name: Powerful Cantrips
desc: Whenever you take the Attack action on your turn to cast a cantrip spell, you Enhance its effect, if the cantrip has an enhanced effect. If not, you double the damage dice of the cantrip. If the cantrip has no Enhance description and does not deal damage, this Power has no effect.

name: Riposte
desc: If your weapon has the Parry Property, an enemy makes a melee attack against you, and you are in range of that enemey, you can choose to spend 1 Focus to make a Weapon Attack for free against them. You use your weapon attack roll as your Defense for the enemy's attack roll (even if the result is lower than your normal Defence). Resolve the enemy's attack against your new Defence. If the attack misses, carry over your result as if you had just made a weapon attack against them. If it is a success, you damage them as per a normal weapon attack.

name: Tricky Tactics
desc:
You gain the following Tactical Actions:

- **Evasive Footwork** - when you take the Move action, you can spend 1 Focus and roll a d6. You add the number rolled to your Defence until you stop moving. So if you take the Move action in the following Round/s, the bonus is carried forward.
- **Feint** - as a Bonus Action, you can choose one character within 5ft of you as your target to Feint against. You then have Advantage on your next Attack roll against that character this Round.
- **Goad** - as an Action, when a target Character that can see or hear you has an Intelligence Stat, you can attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You must make a Charisma check vs their passive Willpower. On a success, the target has Disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of the Round.

name: Commander Tactics
desc:
You gain the following Tactical Actions:

- **Bait and Switch** - as an Attack or Action, when you're within 5ft of an Engaged ally character, you can spend 1 Focus to switch places with that character, provided you spend at least 5 ft of movement. This movement doesn't provoke an Attack of Opportunity. You are now Engaged with that ally's enemy, and any attack they were about to make on your ally is directed at yourself instead.
- **Call the Shot** - As an Action, direct one of your allys to strike. Choose an ally who can see or hear you. That character can immediately make one weapon attack for free. You can choose to spend 1 Focus, and Call the Shot as a Bonus Action instead of an Action.
- **Distract** - as a Bonus Action when you hit a character with a weapon attack, you can distract them, giving your allies an opening. The next Attack roll against the target this Round has Advantage.

name: Vanguard Tactics
desc:
You gain the following Tactical Actions:

- **Charge** - when you use your Action to Move, moving at least 15ft or half your speed (whichever is lower), at the end of the Move you can make 1 Weapon Attack at Advantage as a Bonus Action. You can spend 1 Focus to add 1d6 damage to the attack.
- **Hound** - When you hit a character that is 2 sizes larger than you or less with a weapon attack, you can forego damage to move the target 10ft in a direction of your choice without provoking attacks of opportunity.

name: Leatherlung Tactics
desc:
You gain the following Tactical Actions:

- **Menace** - as an Action, you can attempt to intimidate a character that can see or hear you. You must make a Charisma check vs their passive Willpower. On a success, the target is Frightened of you until the end of the Round.
- **Rally** - as a Bonus Action you can bolster the resolve of one of your allies. When you do so, choose an ally who can see or hear you. They gain temporary Health equal to your Charisma (to a minimum of 1). When you have used Rally on an ally, you cannot use Rally on the same ally until you both finish a Long Rest.

name: Skirmisher Tactics
desc:
You gain the following Tactical Actions:

- **Aim** - as an Attack or Action, you gain Advantage on your next weapon attack which must be a ranged or thrown weapon. You can choose to spend 1 Focus, and Aim as a Bonus Action.
- **Run and Gun** - when you use your Action to Move, you can make 1 Ranged Weapon Attack as a Bonus Action at Disadvantage. You can spend 1 Focus to ignore the Disadvantage
- **Quick Toss** - as a Bonus Action, you make a Ranged Weapon Attack with a weapon that has the thrown property at Disadvantage. You can draw the weapon as part of making this attack. You can spend 1 Focus to ignore the Disadvantage.

name: Improved Focus
desc: Your Focus pool is now 2x your Willpower + your Bonus.
